sub_topic: Calculate the Cartan connection of a manifold.
message_1: Let $M$ be a smooth manifold of dimension $n$ with a Riemannian metric $g$ and a torsion-free affine connection $\nabla$. Calculate the Cartan connection $\omega$ associated to the Levi-Civita connection of $g$. Specifically, for a given tangent vector $X\in T_pM$, calculate $\omega(X)$.
message_2:
To calculate the Cartan connection $\omega$ associated to the Levi-Civita connection $\nabla$ of the Riemannian metric $g$, we first need to introduce a frame $e_1, \dots, e_n$ and its dual coframe $\theta^1, \dots, \theta^n$ at a point $p \in M$. The frame and coframe are related by $g(e_i, e_j) = \delta_{ij}$ and $\theta^i(e_j) = \delta^i_j$.

The Cartan connection $\omega$ is an $\mathfrak{so}(n)$-valued 1-form on $M$, which can be written as a matrix of 1-forms:

$$\omega = \begin{pmatrix}
\omega^1_1 & \cdots & \omega^1_n \\
\vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
\omega^n_1 & \cdots & \omega^n_n
\end{pmatrix}$$

where $\omega^i_j$ are 1-forms on $M$. The Cartan connection is related to the Levi-Civita connection $\nabla$ through the structure equations:

$$d\theta^i = -\omega^i_j \wedge \theta^j$$

and the Cartan's first structure equation:

$$\omega^i_j = -\omega^j_i$$

which implies that the connection is skew-symmetric.

Now, let's calculate $\omega(X)$ for a given tangent vector $X \in T_pM$. We can expand $X$ in the frame $e_1, \dots, e_n$:

$$X = X^i e_i$$

where $X^i = \theta^i(X)$ are the components of $X$ in the coframe. Then, we can calculate the action of $\omega$ on $X$:

$$\omega(X) = \begin{pmatrix}
\omega^1_1(X) & \cdots & \omega^1_n(X) \\
\vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
\omega^n_1(X) & \cdots & \omega^n_n(X)
\end{pmatrix}$$

To find the components $\omega^i_j(X)$, we use the structure equations:

$$d\theta^i(X) = -\omega^i_j(X) \theta^j(X)$$

Since $\nabla$ is torsion-free, we have $d\theta^i = -\Gamma^i_{jk} \theta^j \wedge \theta^k$, where $\Gamma^i_{jk}$ are the Christoffel symbols of the Levi-Civita connection. Therefore,

$$-\Gamma^i_{jk} \theta^j(X) \theta^k(X) = -\omega^i_j(X) \theta^j(X)$$

Comparing the coefficients of $\theta^j(X)$, we get

$$\omega^i_j(X) = \Gamma^i_{jk} X^k$$

Thus, the Cartan connection $\omega(X)$ is given by

$$\omega(X) = \begin{pmatrix}
\Gamma^1_{11} X^1 & \cdots & \Gamma^1_{1n} X^n \\
\vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
\Gamma^n_{n1} X^1 & \cdots & \Gamma^n_{nn} X^n
\end{pmatrix}$$
